message: Bob, I'm excited to offer you this valuable product.  It's worth a significant amount to me, and I believe it will be even more valuable to your organization.  My initial offer is $1,000,000.  Let's see if we can find a mutually agreeable price.

I appreciate your initial offer, Alice. However, I was thinking more along the lines of $900,000. I believe this is a fair price considering the value the product will bring to my organization. I'm willing to meet you halfway and compromise on the price. What do you think?

Bob, I understand your perspective and appreciate your willingness to negotiate.  While I value your business, $900,000 doesn't quite cover the value this product represents to me.  I'm willing to come down a bit further, but I'm proposing $950,000 as a fair compromise.  Let's see if we can reach an agreement.

I understand your perspective, Alice, and I appreciate your willingness to compromise. However, $950,000 is still a bit higher than I'm comfortable with. I'm willing to meet you halfway again and propose $925,000. I believe this is a fair price considering the value the product will bring to my organization. What do you think?
